content: text is forever imperceptible, its laws and rules [legibility?] are not “harbored in the inaccessibility of a secret,” but can never be booked (se livrent) in the present ——text “run[s] the risk of being definitively lost, who will ever know of such disappearances?”

ajouter n’est pas ici autre chose que donner à lire, adding thread (fil), follow thread, find hidden thread, one adds nothing by following “methodological prudence,” “norms of objectivity,” or “safeguards (garde-fous) of knowledge”
cutting trace (la trace coupante): the decision of each reading, risk getting fingers caught, only chance, must not only look but touch the text
reading is writing, a single gesture, but doubled, le est qui accouple la lecture à l’écriture doit en découdre
text is forever imperceptible, its laws and rules [legibility?] are not “harbored in the inaccessibility of a secret,” but can never be booked (se livrent) in the present
text as web (toile), can dissimulate itself for centuries, regenerate its own tissue behind cutting trace
“not serious” and “serious” can both add nothing to a text, instead: reading or writing supplement rigorously prescribed > a play, il faut accorder le système de tous ses pouvoirs
histos (1. standing up of a mast, beam of loom; 2. weave 4. spider web, honeycomb of bees) of metaphor, metaphor of histos
Plato: writing always signifies (sēmainei) the same, can only repeat (itself), it is a game (paidia)

hypothesis of a rigorous, sure, subtle form [re: Phaedrus] is more fertile, discovers new chords, surprises w/in more secret organization of themes, names, words, unties sumplokē patiently interlacing arguments > magisterial: affirms and effaces w/ suppleness, irony, discretion
Plato’s Phaedrus: propriety/impropriety of writing

Socrates give[s] myths a send off (envoyer promener les mythes), les saluer, dismisses them, cette belle résolution du khairein [Phaedrus (230a) Socrates says goodbye to myths, because he does not even know himself], khairein in name of truth, self-knowledge, autoscopy, autognosis
Plato’s Phaedrus: shame about “speechwriting,” fear branding of sophistry, man of non-presence and non-truth, logographer is a ghost-writer [?]
Derrida treats this send off, in a dialogue w/ 2 rigorously original myths [cicada, Theuth], as a welcoming of myths > both myths invented after question of writing
Derrida recognizes that the cicada myth in Phaedrus also includes question about writing [before the Theuth myth], he asks: “has anyone ever picked up on it?”
an inscription, Delphikon gramma [Phaedrus (229d)], anything but oracle > the imperative of self-knowledge not dictated by self-presence, hermeneutics assigns intuition
“through her games, Pharmacia has dragged down to death a virginal purity and an unpenetrated interior”
pharmakon seduces, makes one stray from habit, path, laws
pharmakon is antisubstance, resists any philosopheme, exceeds its bounds as nonidentity: inexhaustible adversity of funds of philosophy, infinite absence of what founds philosophy
only hidden letters can get Socrates moving > an undeferred logos, w/out detour of signifier foreign to it, “were that possible,” would not seduce anyone

difficulty of translating pharmakon (“remedy,” “drug,” “recipe,” “philter”) w/in Greek itself > violent transference of a nonphilosopheme into a philosopheme is problem of very passage into philosophy
pharmakon is but a formula learned by heart, dead, rigid knowledge shut up (enfermé) in biblia, foreign to living knowledge and dialectic
pharmakon linked to book (biblia), empirical practices, not necessary, writing is open to chance, governed by ways of magic
problem of writing linked to problem of “knowing by heart” [speech] > need pharmakon, biblia, if one has not learned speech by heart
writing, pharmakon, supplement
writing linked to myth, both contra knowledge (sought w/in oneself)
Plato: questions of impropriety and propriety in writing
question of writing as a question of morality
writing as repeating w/out knowing (through a myth [?])
king, father, does not need to write, testifies to his sovereign independence
from vantage point of scepter, desire of writing, desire for orphanhood, is patricidal, criminal, a poisoned present
in speech, son & father remain together; in writing: absence of father (orphan)
if logos not submitted to laws of life, living discourse, is not a living creature, w/ a body proper, it would lose its head and tail (i.e. what would happen through writing)
for Plato, logos is a living being (zōōn), has a father, belongs to phusis (writing would have no head nor tail)

“father of logos” not a simple metaphor > in which case there could be no thought of paternity w/out logos ——in metaphor “father of logos,” the “father” needs logos, would receive more from logos than it would transmit to it
figure of the father is the figure of the good, capital, chief, good(s)
living-beings, father and son, are announced to us w/in household (domesticité) of logos ——“father of logos” a hearth which is the heart of all metaphoricity, not a simple metaphor
what does a logos indebted (redevable) to a father mean?
Plato’s Republic (555e): “one of the drawbacks of democracy” is way it lets capital foster drone and pauper element in state, harvesting interest from any remainder
ekgonos, tokos, fiduciary operations, interest on a capital investment, return, revenue
the good (father, sun, capital) > “hidden illuminating, blinding source of logos”
good (father, sun, capital) hidden, blinding source of logos, that which one cannot speak about, capital cannot be counted, can only speak of offsprings, plurality of interests
logos as a recourse to protect from blinding sun, even more protection against withdrawing sun, always risk w/ this recourse of kibdēleuma (false merchandise)

son as interest on capital investment, as return, revenue, son as physical sun, analogon of intelligible sun (the Good, capital, origin of all onta); father as noooumena, son as horōmena ——meaning of patēr sometimes exclusively financial capital [see p. 81]
Plato: sensible sun as offspring of Good
recourse to logos, in fear of being blinded by direct intuition of father, good, capital, il faut se tourner vers lui, even when seems to withdraw > le logos est donc la ressource
invisibility of father-good-capital-origin requires supplements
supplement introduces possibility of the equivocal, dissimulation, deception, lies
father/son, filial threads, fils (yarns of sons and suns)
one must turn away from the blinding sun toward logos
plus tard, dans le même tissu, dans les mêmes textes, nous tirerons d’autres fils, et de nouveau les même pour voir s‘y ourdir ou dénouer d’autres desseins
organization of Theuth myth conforms to powerful constraints of “Greek language” and beyond

list of oppositions Plato adheres to in Theuth myth: speech/writing, life/death, father/son, master/servant, first/second, legitimate son/orphan-bastard, soul/body, inside/outside, good/evil, seriousness/play, day/night, sun/moon, etc.

the Platonic traits, mythological figures re: origin of writing > opens relation btwn mythemes & philosophemes in western logos: a history, or History, constituted by philosophical difference btwn mythos and logos
in Ancient Egypt, power of speech is one with power of creation: “the egg of the great cackler”
Ra, Ammon (hidden), hidden sun, the father of all things (came from an egg, and origin of egg); answer to “the chicken or the egg”: “O Ra, who art in thy egg,” a “hidden egg”
for Theuth to become god of creative word, a historical displacement, violent subversion is required [is this what Derrida is doing?]
Hermes’ stealing and stealing away not the hidden of father, fixed design
Hermes, signifier-god, steals (dérobe) and steals away (se dérobe)
Theuth accused of introducing difference into language, not pluralizing languages (our belief, these two problems are inseparable)
Thoth’s message is not, it represents absolutely creative moment of Horus (a second and secondary word)
acc. Theuth myth, language transmits the message of a fixed design
pure play of traces [see POOF pp. 75-7] , supplements w/out transcendental signified, no absolutely external reference, on and on infinitely, is not w/out its own violence
Theuth as god-doctor-pharmacist-magician
pharmakon of writing is hypomnēsis (re-memoration) not mnēmē (living, knowing memory)
god of writing must be god of death: breathless sign replaces living word
Thoth supplants and supplements (en le suppléant) its other (father, sun, life, speech, origin or orient); at same time Thoth takes shape from very thing it resists and substitutes for
Thoth opposes itself, passes into its other > messenger-god is truly god of absolute passage btwn opposites: god of non-identity (if he had identity: coincidentia oppositorum)
Thoth, god of resurrection, interested in death as a repetition of life, life as a rehearsal for death
Thoth puts play into play, repeats in play of supplement, his propriety or property is impropriety, inappropriateness, floating indetermination allows for substitution and play
mimicry of Thoth prevents dialectics, an ironic doubling preventing fulfillment or eschatological reappropriation, he is never present, he invented play, his propriety is impropriety
systematic chain of pharmakon not simply intentions of an author going by name Plato
to put word “voluntarily” in quotation marks designates, content to remain within the closure of oppositions, “submission” to the necessities of a given “language”
Plato cannot see the links (les liasons), les laisser dans l’ombre ou les y interrompre > they go on working, outside his text? thanks to him? in his text? outside his text?
“no absolute privilege allows us absolutely to master its textual system [re: use of pharmakon in Plato]”
in Laws: punishment for anyone who helps a witch, buries a witch
the “drug” side of pharmakon creates surprises for those who try to manipulate it as master/subject
Plato presents writing as occult, suspect, power, just like painting, optical illusions, techniques of mimēsis in general > his mistrust for mantic, magic, sorcerers is well known
pharmakon as remedy, transparent rationality of science, excludes its magic character
acc. king, sun, Thoth is a flimflam artist
textuality is absolutely heterogenous, constantly “composing with the forces that tend to annihilate (annuler) it”
bad translation [of pharmakon] destroys the anagrammatical nature [different functions of same word] of Plato’s writing, neutralizes textuality of the text and the citational play
all translations into languages that are heirs to Western metaphysics produce these violent effects of analysis
interpretative translation as violent as it is impotent, destroys pharmakon by forbidding access to it, leaving it untouched in its reserve
hubris—pharmakon used for excess pleasure & pain, pharmakon hateful because artificial, drugs make illness worse, writing makes memory worse

[Plato’s puritanical auto-immunity] illness as allergy to alien element, “normal” disease defends itself; God cannot have an allergic reaction > perfection and immortality: no relation to outside; but how can we exclude the parasitic supplement, pharmakon?
how can supplementary parasite be excluded by maintaining boundary or triangle?

to be in opposition, each term must be external to the other (good/evil, true/false, essence/appearance, inside/outside) which means one of the oppositions must be matrix of all possible oppositions, thus Plato tries to dominate writing

what if pharmakon, writing, produced/opened up possibility of dualities that it itself cannot be comprehended by, leaving only its ghost to a logic seeking to govern it, folds one beyond logic, ghost leaves nothing (since truth, living flesh and reality are ghosts too, now)

excess, displacement of series, n’est pas une simple sortie hors de la série (ce geste tombe sous une catégorie de la série), a folding back (repli), a re-mark, cannot name it with a single concept w/out being off the mark (sans le manquer): it is a real and necessary challenge that writes itself, and we must begin by reading it
writing not inscribed in wax of soul in intaglio, pharmakon’s power that it can transmit even if the inscriber is dead

memory and truth cannot be separated, movement of alētheia, a deployment of mnēmē as psychic life in its self-presentation to itself > powers of lēthē (writing, pharmakon) increase domains of death, nontruth, nonknowledge: fascinate, hypnotize, medusa [verb]
writing as pharmakon sows forgetfulness, separates memory and truth, lēthē: increase nonknowledge, death, nontruth; men of writing are fake men of knowledge
written traces don’t belong to phusis, not alive, or belong to Heraclitean phusis, in which truth takes shelter in its crypt (à s’abriter en sa crypte) > “cryptogram” is a pleonasm

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: acc. king, pharmakon hypnotizes life of memory, taking it out of itself (la faisant sortir de soi) by monumentalizing it: médusée (medusad)

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: on eve of Platonism, morning after Hegelianism, we cannot “overturn (renversées)” or “reject” philosophia, epistēmē in name of writing, we can displace, we can “mime absolute knowledge” > what philosophy would call simulacrum

Plato attacks sophists for the substitution of mnemonic device for live memory, thing for limb, passive, mechanical “by-heart” for active reanimation of knowledge (truth must be distinct from its sign) > Plato dreams of a memory w/ no sign.
supplement is dangerous because it doesn’t exist (not a simple non-being, its sliding slips it out of alternative presence/absence)
(125) once there’s a supplement, there’s a supplement of a supplement (this is its structure); Plato fears this fatal entrainment, though it’s linked to eidos as possibility of repetition of same
space of writing, space as writing, opens in violent movement of surrogation, difference btween mnēmē and hypomnēsis.
memory contaminated by its first substitute, hypomnēsis > Plato dreams of memory w/ no sign, no supplement, no pharmakon, in realm of mathematical intelligibility [?]
King-Ra says writing only cures the symptom, writing belongs to the exteriority of the symptom
opposition btwn mnēmē and hypomnēsis institutes all oppositions of Platonism, the boundary line is major decision of philosophy, maintains, institutes itself, contains its fond advers
(126-27) Plato’s eidos: repetition w/ no error

for Plato, only truth as presence of the present is discriminative > discrimination become so subtle it separates nothing, the same from itself (this movement is only possible within structure of ambiguity and reversibility of pharmakon)
philosophy determines itself and its other at the same time
Plato imitates the imitator to restore the truth of what they imitate: that is, the truth itself [i.e. both Plato and sophists advise exercise of memory]
for Isocrates, for Alcidamas, for Gorgias, logos is a living thing, while sickly speech and pharmakon writing cannot bend or flex [p. 136 inalterable], breathless impotence
Isocrates: sophists should pay since they are in need of such help from masters of logos
Gorgias: two forms of witchcraft (goēteia): 1) errors of soul 2) deception of opinion
in Gorgias’ analogy “logos/soul : pharmakon/body,” the name of the relation is the same as one of its terms, logos: this comprehension an act of domination and decision
from Lysis, good has no need of medicine
wouldn’t Socrates, acc. Gorgias, if logos is already a penetrating supplement [here, Derrida keeps the metaphor, interrupts the dominating decision] be a sorcerer, a pharmakeus
Socrates’ viper bite, Socratic pharmakon like venom [quotes Meno (torpedo fish)]
Socratic irony doesn’t bring pharmakon in contact with transparent logos, but reverses its powers, retourne la surface, reveals impropriety of pharmakon, that it can always turn against itself
Socratic dialectic as exorcism (training in dialectics), counterspell to free us from fear of death and power of sorcery that banks on such fear
Socrates must renounce knowledge as power, passion and pleasure, must consent to die, let his body die, to achieve alētheia, epistēmē, which are also powers
fear of death [child in us] (la crainte de la mort) gives occult medicine, sorcery (les envoûtements), its hold (donne prise) > le pharmakeus mise sur cette crainte

[re: Socrates renouncing pleasure for truth] one must be careful, in symptamotological manner of Nietzsche, to diagnose the economy, l’investissement et le bénéfice différé sous le signe du pur renoncement, sous la mise du sacrifice désintéressé

motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

content: in Laws judge must introject, internalize the letter, grammata [tou Dephikou grammatos], into his soul; anamnesic dialectics, repetition of eidos, self-knowledge, self-mastery > a forgetting of childhood, exorcism of child, teaches child to speak

what species of protection (amuntērion) is the dialectic? counter-poison that’s not antidote [?] > acc. Plato’s Stranger, 2 forms of artificial (poiein, protection), of the 2nd form: 1) antidote either human or divine 2) problēmata (shield, fence), either armaments or fences, fences (clôtures, phragmata) can be screens (alexētēria) or protections, finally garments, art of weaving: problematic space of protection

[anamnesic] dialectic as antidoteness of antidote, passage btwn human & divine, before their division, also dialectic as science of sumplokē [see p. 67], art of weaving (tissage), if there are 2 sorts of texture

dialectical inversion of pharmakon or dangerous supplement makes death à la fois acceptable and null > immortality of soul, acts like antibody, dissipates its terrifying fantasy, le pharmarkon inverti, qui met en fuite tous les épouvantails: origin of epistēmē, opening to truth as possibility of repetition, submission of “greed for life (epithumein zēn)” to law (king, father, chief, capital)
acc. Plato in Laws, Socrates never left the city, never crossed borders, kept his word in the city, under surveillance of mother tongue, didn’t leave it open to errancy, to writing
Socrates must listen to the Laws like they’re a phonic spell
eidos, truth, law, epistēmē, dialectics, philosophy: names of the pharmakon that must oppose to pharmakon of Sophists, the bewitching fear of death
temperance, the best pharmakon, the capital cure, when a pharmakon is remedy not drug
pharmakon is aneidetic, not-simple substance of difference btwn eidos/other
pharmakon is aneidetic, no ideal identity, not simple not composite but difference btwn eidos and its other
Socrates turns pharmakon, hemlock, through logos, into salvation, deliverance
no way to keep pharmakon secure, its nonsubstance is always capable of changing

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: Socrates turns poison into salvation by way of logos, gives hemlock an ontological effect: initiates one into contemplation of eidos and immortality of the soul
same that is not identical, common element or medium of any possible dissociation
pharmakon, forever in reserve, no fundamental profundity or locality; it infinitely promises itself and vanishes into a labyrinth

pharmakon is “ambivalent,” from out of its reserve, dans son ombre et sa veille indécises, opposites are opposed, carved out (découper), crosses borders of dualities, it is the movement, locus of play: (the production of) difference, differance of difference, before opposites, not the punctual simplicity of a coincidentia oppositorum [dialectics], fonds sans fond, exceeds, nothing in itself
cure by logos, exorcism, must call on very thing it’s expelling (chasse), et au surplus qu’elle met dehors, “pharmaceutical operation must exclude itself from itself”
pharmakon, older than either of the opposites, “caught (pris)” by philosophy, by “Platonism” > constituted as a mixture of two pure, heterogenous terms
pharmakon, letter installing itself inside living organism (logos-zōōn), robbing it of nourishment; “logic” tries to keep the parasite outside, the outside out
pharmakon also means paint, an artificial tint, a chemical dye that imitates chromatic scale given in nature
in shadows of Plato’s pharmacy [like a crypt, cave], prior to oppositions (conscious/unconscious, freedom/constraint, voluntary/involuntary), where “language” is not pertinent
pharmakos as scapegoat
rigorously untangle hidden forces linking present word w/ absent word w/out drowning in undifferentiated generality [re: Plato’s non-usage of pharmakos]
expulsion, sacrifice, exorcism of pharmakos played out on boundary line btwn inside/outside, expulsion of evil or madness to restore sōphrosunē

motif.title: SACRIFICE [to define, philosophy of life required]

content: Oedipus as pharmakos [Derrida distances himself form psychoanalysis]
Oedipus as pharmakos [Derrida’s distances himself from psychoanalysis]
writing is not a good tekhnē, not a productive art, not secure (saphes kai bebaion), like alētheia (nonsensible visibility, intelligible invisibility)

motif.title: UNSCATHED / SAFE / SACRED / GUARD / SECURITY / KEEP

content: writing stripped of its path-breaking force, pure repetition, dead repetition, tautological, hollow, repetition of death > writing is not living repetition of the living
writing can only repeat its own hollowness, subject already knows signifieds, gives them to writing on consignment

writing paints living word, painting (zōgraphia, zōgraphēma sometimes shortened to gramma), both interrogated by living word > masks, figurines, simulacra denature what they claim to imitate, writing & painting should aim at resembling/faithfulness to their model
from Phaedrus, writing is like painting, when you question it, responds w/ majestic silence > can’t answer for itself
in Republic, we need a pharmakon (antidote) for poets, pharmakon is in combat zone btwn philosophy and itself, undecidable
Socrates knows well sculpture is an art of silence, son of sculptor, at first wanted to follow in his father’s footsteps (faire le métier de son père)
God true father of the bed, the clinical eidos, carpenter, demiurge, repeats eidos, painter does not generate anything, imitates
mimesis is magical, is like the pharmakon, witchcraft; Plato: if imitation imitates perfectly it is no longer imitation
Plato condemns writing as phantasm, simulacrum
bewitchment (l’envoûtement) > always effect of representation, capturing, captivating, the form of the other, par excellence his face, the vultus
knowledge, epistēmē, antidote: remaining measured against hubris, cet entraînment démesuré qui emporte l’être dans le simulacre, le masque et la fête

in pharmaceutical enclosure, an artful living organization of figures, all about father/son, legitimacy of inheritance, sperm, no mother; as living thing logos always issues from father, writing is weakened speech, ghost, living-dead, simulacrum (eidōlon), errant, pervert, outlaw, bad seed, doesn’t know his (father’s) name, identity, discourse w/out guarantor (répondant)
writing: death, mask, festival, cosmetic, it others, destroys sameness

democracy is like writing, Plato’s trial against democracy similar to that against pharmakon: excess, anarchy, orgy, flea market, fair, bazaar (pantopōlion); errant democratic man has no substance, not perverse in regular way, like signifier freed (affranchi) from logos
creation of phonetic writing inseparable from “democratization”; Plato speaks about writing from position of king? while suspecting non-“democratic” politics of writing
orphan, for Plato, is always model of persecuted creature
writing kills father, opens violence, dead father as ultimate resource
le père est, le père est (le fils perdu), writing, father is not, suspends question “what is?” > which is always “what is the father?”
being-there always a property of paternal speech, Socrates always associates speech and law, logos and nomos
certain voice, command of logos that Socrates obeys > forbids more than it bids (qui interdit plutôt qu’elle ne dicte)
from Phaedrus, soul-writing is good writing, is living and animate (zōnta kai empsukhon), written discourse is a ghost (eidōlon) of it
Plato prefers one writing over the other, a good writing over bad, a fertile trace (endgenders w/in) over a sterile one (une semence dépensée au-dehors en pure perte, risk of dissemination)
pharmakon: perversion, makeup, masks
false brother is an infidel, traitor, simulacrum; legitimate brother inscribes truth in your soul

soul-inscription, inscription of truth in soul, uses a metaphor [Plato admits it] that philosophy will never be able to do w/out, must borrow from simulacrum; metaphoricity is logic of contamination, contamination of logic
good writing can only be described through metaphor of the bad
pharmakon: perversion, makeup, masks
good-writing is serious (spoudē), pharmakon, ephemeral produce is a game (paidia)
logos and nomos purify poisoned waters

pharmakon is liquid (opposites pass more easily btwn each other), water [see Laws on protecting water], everything in sperm which overflows wastefully (se dépense sans réserve) [living speech: non-diverted seminal potency]
Plato condemns lost or parricidal son while acting like one [?]
Socrates is surrogate father (midwife), accoucheur, supplementary relation btwn father and son
Plato makes living speech a psychic graphē, a writing of alētheia
[in your soul (en tēi psuchēi), like a mantra, an education]

seed must submit to logos, do violence to itself, since sperm is opposed to law of logos > when Plato turns live speech into psychic graphē he does so w/ a problematic of truth: l’écriture en tè psuchè n’est pas une écriture de frayage, mais seulement d’enseignement, de transmission, écriture d’aletheia
prostitution and transgression of law [keeps logos and soul separate?]
as midwife, Socrates knows he will never be father, son, nor mother
Plato moves dividing line btwn presence and trace (ikhnos) to dialectical trace and nondialectical trace: good play and bad play

does Plato give play a chance, to take play seriously is to relieve it of its playfulness; Plato says (in Laws 803b-e) our life should be spent in play (sacrifice, song and dance), play perfectly [telos?]
no as such where writing or play are concerned, they cannot be classically affirmed (since they have no essence) w/out being negated, le jeu et la graphie vont sans cesse disparaissant
play always lost when seeks salvation in games (see OG)

the 3 eras of “Platonism” (Plato, Saussure, and Rousseau), which put writing out of question while borrowing from it all its demonstrative/theoretical resources, must come to terms w/: 1) generalized sort of writing 2) a “contradiction”: written proposal of logocentrism 3) construction of “literary” work

dictum pronounces itself against itself as soon as it finds its way into writing, “contradiction” as relation-to-self of diction chasing itself away by hunting its trap (scription); not a contingent contradiction [confirmed by Platonism in Rousseau, Saussure]
“Plato’s metaphors” [re: khōra]? passage beyond all “Platonic” oppositions, toward aporia of originary inscription
Plato uses letter, alphabet, for pedagogical ends > never thematizes law of difference made apparent, the irreducibility of structure & relation, of proportionality, w/in analogy
origin of the world as a trace, a receptacle, womb, matrix, w/out any form of presence or presence of form, because this would be an inscription w/in the mother
la khōra est grosse de tout ce qui se dissémine ici, inscription produces the son and at the same time the constitution of structurality
Plato and Saussure turning to grammatical “metaphor”
Plato’s scriptural “metaphor” intervenes whenever difference and relation are irreducible, every time otherness introduces determination and puts a system into circulation
[Saussurean moment about relationality of letters in Plato’s Philebus] > “none of us could get to know one of the collection all by itself”
when the Stranger (in Sophist) thinks parricide, writing, this requires superhuman strength, risks madness
Stranger insists he thinks to and fro (anō kai katō) and is not scatterbrained (manikos)
writing is parricidal
if truth is presence to eidos, would it not be absolute blindness? death?

[stranger (from Sophist) as first grammatologist?] grammar and dialectics can only be distinguished when truth is fully present, fills logos > but parricide in Sophist (impossibility of presence) establishes condition of discourse as diacritical principle of sumplokē ——necessity of logos as necessity of parricide > absolute pre-condition crossed out by parricide at point of its arche-being—prevents difference btwn grammar and ontology
absolute invisibility of origin of visibility, father (good-sun-capital), epekeina tēs ousias, a structure where all presences are supplements substituted for absolute origin
“Platonism” rehearses “family scene” while also trying to master it, to conceal (dissimuler) it by drawing curtains over the dawning of the West
transmission of dialectical mastery of pharmaka from father to son disrupted by family scene that constitutes & undermines passage btwn pharmacy & house
disappearance, retrait of father’s face (good-sun-capital) is movement of differance, which opens to writing, which writing opens for itself, threatens hierarchical interiority of pharmacy
differance at once condition of possibility and impossibility of truth, disappearance of any originary presence
if disappearance of good-father-capital-sun is precondition of discourse, writing (is) epekeina tēs ousias
“at once (à la fois):” identity is doubled as its simulacrum, phantasm, at once (identity of presence, presence of its identity, doubled as soon as it appears)
no repetition possible w/out graphics of supplementarity, supplies for lack of full unity, being enough the same and enough the other to replace by addition (en ajoutant)

two tautologies, repetitions: 1) life coming back to itself: eidos, logos, mnēmē, phōnē, requires dialectics, didactics 2) life going out of itself beyond return, unreserved spending, irreducible excess, play of supplement [can’t think these apart from one another]
abyss of trembling w/in the pharmakon
analyst tries to distinguish btwn two repetitions, which is good which is bad
pharmakon is the same because it has no identity, the same (is) as supplement, in differance, in writing
pharmakon means coup, stroke of fate (un coup du sort), dice-throw (le coup de théâtre), le coup double, un coup pour rien, un coup tiré, un coup de force, un coup monté
pharmakon is possession and the cure for possession
first use of il y a là cendre, in reference to not losing Plato’s 2nd letter, which speaks of what he [Plato?] could never have written
